snippet: Financiers are putting their political contributions behind Republicans, who don’t threaten their way of doing business like Democrats do.
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts financial industry's strong support of Republican presidential candidates shows that Wall Street is concerned that Democrats will follow through on promises to reign in industry's excesses; contends most Democrats would likely retain financial reforms of 2010 but be blocked from further action by Republican lawmakers; holds differences between Republicans and Democrats are far more significant than those between individual Democrats.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Financiers are putting their political contributions behind Republicans, who don’t threaten their way of doing business like Democrats do.

headline.main: Democrats, Republicans and Wall Street Tycoons
